decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly applying pressure with low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The deck also includes cards that provide additional damage or utility, while utilizing Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion for additional value. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and utility lands, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before the opponent can stabilize or mount a defense.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced, aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and direct damage spells. It utilizes low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Heartfire Hero to pressure the opponent quickly, supported by spells like Infuriate and Monstrous Rage to push through damage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and consistency to the deck. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault while using spell-based removal to clear the way for your creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and applying pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing mana ramp creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, it aims to cast powerful threats like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition early in the game. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Elite Spellbinder help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Collected Company provides additional creature options. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption to secure a quick victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and use them to deal damage to your opponent. Cards like Sleight of Hand, Consider, and Opt help you dig through your deck and fill your graveyard, while spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse help you deal with threats on the board. Using Treasure Cruise to draw more cards and control elements like Spell Pierce to protect your creatures, this deck aims to be fast and aggressive in order to overwhelm your opponent.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to establish board control through countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage with Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge. It also aims to stall the game with cards like Discontinuity and Settle the Wreckage until it can close out the game with finishers like Dream Trawler and March of Otherworldly Light. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to both blue and white mana sources, with utility lands like Castle Ardenvale and Castle Vantress providing additional value.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful creatures. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by removing their threats with cards like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, while also protecting your own creatures with Leyline Binding. The Overlord creatures serve as win conditions, providing a strong late-game presence to close out the game. The deck also leverages powerful mana fixing lands to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors of mana for its spells.

The key strategy of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board with a variety of discard spells and removal cards while maintaining card advantage through the use of Mazemind Tome. The deck aims to control the game by efficiently dealing with threats and out-valuing the opponent with powerful creatures like Graveyard Trespasser and Bloodletter of Aclazotz. Additionally, the deck's manabase is designed to support a variety of utility lands like Field of Ruin and Hive of the Eye Tyrant, ensuring consistent mana sources and options for late-game advantage.

The deck focuses on playing cheap spells to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability, allowing for multiple reanimations in a single turn. With a mix of card draw, burn spells, and disruptive creatures like Picklock Prankster, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a barrage of threats. The inclusion of Treasure Cruise and other delve cards helps to refill the hand after expending resources. The deck aims to maintain pressure and close out games quickly through a combination of aggression and efficient card advantage.
